timeline.bodyText: Personally, I think that this code belongs in optaplanner-core. The reason it's not there, is that the annotations used prevent that. Simple solution: put the impl in core, but leave the annotating bells and whistles here.
timeline.author: triceo

replies.bodyText: Also, I don't know why this class exists. Why substitute one part of code that does reflection, with another one that still does reflection?
replies.author: triceo

replies.bodyText:
This is for Graal: it can't handle MethodHandles, but it can handle old-fashioned reflection.
Once our gizmo work starts, we can probably ditch MethodHandles alltogether (they are faster than old-fasioned reflection, but slower than gizmo code generation)
replies.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText:
This is definitely an open issue to clean this up better, indeed. I 've created a jira to track:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/PLANNER-2002
replies.author: ge0ffrey
